document.ModsDocTitle: A taxonomic study of Chinese species of the alberti group of Metaphycus (Hymenoptera, Encyrtidae)
document.docAuthor: Wang, Ying, Li, Cheng-De & Zhang, Yan-Zhou
document.docTitle: Metaphycus dorsalis Wang, Li & Zhang, 2013, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic study of Chinese species of the alberti group of Metaphycus (Hymenoptera, Encyrtidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic study of Chinese species of the alberti group of Metaphycus (Hymenoptera, Encyrtidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: ♀, China, Yunnan, Xishuangbanna: 2009.XI.9, Coll. G. Tang (IZCAS).
2♀♀, the same as holotype; 2♀♀, 1♂, Sichuan, Chengdu, 1961.VII.1-5, Coll. D. X. Liao (IZCAS).

Head with polygonally reticulate sculpture and mesh size slightly less than that of one eye facet; frontovertex about one-fourth head width; ocelli forming an acute angle about 30°; eye not quite reaching occipital margin, separated by much less than diameter of a facet; frontovertex subparallel and from anterior ocellus slightly wider anteriorly; scrobes shallow and U-shaped; antenna with scape about 3 -3.1x as long as broad; funicle with F1-F4 smallest, F5 a little larger than F4 but transverse, F6 largest and slightly wider than long; linear sensilla only on F5 and F6; clava 3-segmented, its apex more or less rounded but with a short slightly oblique truncation; mandible relatively broad with three subequal, apical teeth; palpal formula 2-2 ( Fig. 3), notaular lines reaching about 0.4 x across mesoscutum; fore wing venation and setation as in Fig. 4; ovipositor (Fig. 2) slightly exserted, about 5.6 x as long as ovipositor sheath.
Relative measurements: HW 13, FV 3, FVL 7, POL 1.5, AOL 3.5, OOL 0.5, OCL 2, POD 1, AOD 1, EL 9, EW 6,MS 5, SL 6, SW 2, FWL 35, FWW 14, HWL 23, HWW 5, OL 10, GL 2, MT 10.
The specific epithet of this new species refers to the medial longitudinal dark brown strip on the mesoscutum and scutellum.

Antenna with scape about 3 -3.1x as long as broad; mesoscutum and scutellum with brown line running from front edge of mesoscutum to apex of scutellum; legs pale yellow; fore wing hyaline and with linea calva interrupted. Using the keys of Trjapitzin (1989) and Guerrieri and Noyes (2000) , this species runs to Metaphycus dispar (keys couplet 11 and 15). It can be separated from dispar as follows: mesoscutum and scutellum with a longitudinal dark brown strip in the middle (in dispar, mesoscutum and scutellum without a longtitudinal dark brown strip). Scape about 3 x as long as broad (in dispar, scape about 3.3 x as long as broad). Ovipositor about 5 x as long as ovipositor sheath (in dispar, ovipositor about 4.3 x as long as ovipositor sheath). The colour of the radicle is dark brown, and the metanotum is orange (in dispar, radicle with yellow, and metanotum is brown).

caption.paragraph: Plate 1. A palpal formula 2-2 ( Metaphycus chinensis sp. n.) B palpal formula 3-3 ( Metaphycus eriococci ) C palpal formula 4-3 ( Metaphycus liaoi ) D thorax of Metaphycus dorsalis sp. n. in dorsal view.
Figures 1-7. Metaphycus dorsalis sp. n. Female: 1 antenna 2 ovipositor 3 palpal formula 4 fore wing 5 fore leg 6 mid leg 7 hind leg.
